summary: Thomas, re: Cyberpunk Hytale mod
mainText:
'Initially, Cybertale was a "joke": I quickly sketched a minigame idea as a poster for fun.
Here is the image I made (very rough!).

But we thought it would be really interesting to prove 
@Hytale
  style could work outside medieval fantasy, so we made a proof of concept ingame!'

summary: Simon, re: size of dev team

summary: Simon gives statement on Hytale funding
mainText:
'Pleased to announce that we have officially secured the next two years of development costs through pre-purchases. Combined with my personal commitment of ten years, we are looking very strong for the future ‚ù§Ô∏è

Thank you all for the support.

Hytale is saved.
We are almost home.'

summary: Thomas, re: Polina's recent posts
mainText: 'Karma is back on your side. The curse is lifted. You did sooooo much for the art of this game, people will realize soon. ‚ù§Ô∏è'

summary: Thomas, re: Arabic language support
mainText: 'I believe we are using some communautary tool that allows people from everywhere in the world to contribute to the translation of the game. I think we will post more informations soon, but yes there should be arabic too at some point!'

summary: Thomas, re: user feeling bad for spawning discourse around avatar art style

summary: Polina, re: time slowing as launch approaches

summary: Polina, re: Slamma not emotionally comprehending Hytale launching tomorrow
mainText: 'same, I started on this project more than 10 years ago and went through, one might say, some cursed times ü§£'

summary: Polina, re: Hytale launch

summary: Ktar, re: Find the Kweebec
mainText: 'Filter blocks contain a list of a lot of block types from a category. Mostly used for masking a brush to a category of block type. You can also put them in a brush, but why would you. QA asked that, they crashed, I fixed it üòÇ'

summary: PXL_Panda, re: Hytale launch
mainText: 'just one more day ü§Ø'

summary: Thomas, re: user saying to adapt to AI 'art'
mainText: 'Yeah in France we had a tendency to cut King's heads when they weren't respecting our rights, this is our way of adapting. üëç'

summary: Thomas, re: non-human playable races
mainText: 'It doesn't affect gameplay tho'

summary: Thomas, re: non-human playable races
mainText: 'It's not scrapped, the avatar body is a humanoid body, you can make human looking characters but you can also have fantasy skin colors, ears and features. We will add more body attachments in the future'

summary: Thomas, re: user asking him NOT to change avatars
mainText: 'It is one of the reasons why the game stands out, it is true. Thanks for the kind words'

summary: Thomas, re: avatars looking uncanny without noses
mainText: 'I'm sure someone will make a nose mod haha'

summary: Thomas, re: user asking if the avatar art style will be reworked in the future
mainText: 'We will ofc keep improving characters over time but therr won't be any changes on resolution for example. This isn't Hytale art style :). I'm proud of the work art team has done on characters, and some people won't like. It's OK'

summary: Thomas, re: user asking if the avatar art style will be reworked in the future
mainText: 'It's OK for people to make fun of things. Some people are very used to Minecraft art style, but Hytale this isn't Minecraft and characters will be more detailed for many important reasons (emotions, animations, close up). I would advise them to try the game first.'

summary: Thomas shares his feelings before launch
mainText: 'I also think a lot about the team, past and present members who contributed at various level and went through the same things. Love you all ‚ù§Ô∏è'

summary: Thomas shares his feelings before launch
mainText: 'I really want to thank @Simon_Hypixel for saving the project. And collateraly, saving my sanity. I trust him and his vision for the game. The guy is working day and night with the team to get this game out ‚ù§Ô∏è'

summary: Thomas shares his feelings before launch
mainText: 'Hytale won't be perfect when it releases, we have ton of things to fix, but at least it exists and we will fix it overtime.'

summary: Thomas shares his feelings before launch
mainText: 'I was lucky to have in my life some people i love, who supported me no matter what, and helped me power through difficult time. And the community too: they don't realize how much they helped. I feel really grateful.'

summary: Thomas shares his feelings before launch
mainText: 'I for sure feel frustration for the years we lost due to "the multiple events", but right now I mostly feel relief. It was so hard to see this collapse past years...so many times I thought about giving up when looking at where project was going. Idk how many times I collapsed.'

summary: Thomas shares his feelings before launch
mainText: 'To me it was not just a job, my life and brain was organized around Hytale. I went through a lot of creative "fights" to protect the original vision. It took so much space in my life that sometimes it was hard to disconnect and enjoy other things. I learnt to do better with time.'

summary: Thomas shares his feelings before launch
mainText: 'Going from working 10 years, being fired, not being able to show the result of your work on your passion project, to the resurrection of it, feels pretty crazy. I have fresh scars due to how past years unfolded. I am still recovering.'

summary: Thomas shares his feelings before launch
mainText: 'Not sure how I will react when it goes live, but I will for sure have a tissue box for my eyes next to me.'

summary: Ktar, re: Find the Kweebec
mainText: 'First ^ Congratulations.'

summary: Ktar, re: including mob/npc spawn points in prefabs

summary: Ktar, re: Find The Kweebec
mainText:
'Hytale: Find the Kweebec!
I was always fascinated by the hidden object games. Would be fun to spend time on making actual hidden object games in Hytale with more interesting hand-built scene instead of random noise. Filter Blocks testing.'

mainText: 'Really awesome, thanks for that'

summary: Thomas, re: user asking where the old sheep went
mainText: 'These are babies!'
